summary:
I'm a driven person with a strong analytical mindset concerning (financial) institutions, IT and processes. My way of learning is by doing, in a self-starting way, and also asking the necessary questions. Previous work and my academic background have led to experience in project-driven surroundings, working in teams and analyzing business requirements, business settings and data integrity. 

My experience lies in business consultancy/analysis and information analysis,  mostly in the health insurance sector and telecommunications on the aspects of IP Address Management, IT Asset Management and IT Service Management. I also have implementation and application management experience in Oracle ERP systems and functional and end-user experience concerning Oracle ERP systems and Oracle Business Intelligence systems. 

Within a business setting I like to act as an interpreter between the business and the software implementers. I'm characterized as an open and enthusiastic person with a problem-solving mentality, who likes to get the job done for the customer while providing help and explanation where needed. The latter is what gets me truly motivated. Devising and realizing solutions for customers is what energizes me: the more complex, the better. My challenge is found in projects on the cutting surface of IT systems, processes, architecture, data and infrastructure. I can work well alone, yet I excel within a, preferably Agile, team approach.

certifications.name: IREB Certified Professional for Requirements Engineering Foundation Level
Risk and Cost Driven Architecture (RCDA) Practitioner
Oracle eBS R12 Financial Overview LVC Certificate of Completion
ITIL® Foundation Certificate in IT Service Management
Oracle Business Intelligence Foundation Suite 11g Certified Implementation Specialist

profile_positions.description: Product Owner for IT products that are core to VECOZO's health care IT services. As key stakeholder for the Scrum project (and the software development team) and first point of contact, I maintain relations with internal stakeholders such as product management and external stakeholders such as health insurers and government agencies.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner

profile_positions.description: VECOZO is the pivotal digital communication player within and between health care parties in the Netherlands. A range of IT services are provided to these health care players and my job is to analyze information, requirements and data to facilitate development of these IT services (SCRUM based).
profile_positions.title: Information Analyst

profile_positions.description:
KPN's NIO department in collaboration with stakeholders across-the-board within KPN launched a program to redesign and implement improved architecture, processes, tooling and verification aspects for IP Address Management, IT Asset Management and everything in between. A core team was formed to ratify and implement these aspects.

I was asked to join this core team, which works on Scrum Agile basis delivering every two weeks. My role was analyzing IST and SOLL for IPAM and ITAM aspects, constructing solutions and guiding departments in implementing solutions for the aforementioned aspects. 

Tools: JIRA, SOLIDServer DDI, Infoblox, MS-Excel, MS-Visio, MS-Powerpoint
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Consultant

profile_positions.description:
KPN's NIO department employed a configuration management database, renamed NIO CMDB, to facilitate its configuration management, software management and vulnerability management processes. 

The CGI project team was in charge of innovating, upgrading and improving this CMDB and related software applications. My job here was to be responsible for and to be subject matter expert in the analysis of data, requirements, processes and information to develop a solution for an increment, being an innovation, fix or improvement. Solution development here started with determining feasibility and impact of the aforementioned developed solution and ended with bringing this solution to the production environment, with all the needed steps in between. My added value to KPN here was a quick switching and problem-solving attitude and an abstract mindset. My added value to the project team was my ability to effectively transfer my knowledge on to my colleagues and my ability to guide them in increasing their added value to KPN. 

Our project work resulted in a very satisfied KPN department as customer and additional projects coming our way. The project team functioned smoothly and team members regarded the collaboration as fun, satisfying and educational. We have realized over five major releases up to now and have developed solutions for complex problems / opportunities to be realized in the future. 

Tools: BMC Atrium, GLPI, SAP Business Objects, Oracle SQL Developer, Infoblox, HP ALM, MS-Excel, MS-Visio, MS-Powerpoint
profile_positions.title: Senior Information Analyst

profile_positions.description:
The configuration management database for the NetCo division of KPN, NetCo CMDB, was instated by CGI to provide a centralized administration of configuration items intended to decrease vulnerability and increase awareness. KPN and CGI decided on an incremental approach to the interfacing of departments and their source systems to the NetCo CMDB. 

The CGI project team, tasked with the incremental interfacing, approached me to perform information analyses on said source systems and the different needs of departments using these source systems. With my hands-on mentality, problem solving attitude and particularly my ability to continuously switch between software, documents, department data and theoretical configuration, I managed to be added value for the team as well as managed to help each department. 

As a result all tasked department assets have been correctly made available in the NetCo CMDB within time and budget constraints. Together with the CGI project team, I have designed, tested and implemented new functionalities as well as improvements on NetCo CMDB and non-NetCo CMDB source systems (such as GLPI and Infoblox). Additionally, new configuration items have been configured by me and the project team acquired maintenance of (parts of) source systems.
 
Tools: BMC Atrium, GLPI, SAP Business Objects, Toad for MYSQL, Oracle SQL Developer, Infoblox, VMWare Workstation, HP ALM, MS-Excel
profile_positions.title: Information Analyst

profile_positions.description: My aim was to assist and guide companies and their departments in realising IT related goals, through analysis, consultancy and proposing and achieving solutions.
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Consultant || Information Analyst

profile_positions.description: I help guide IT transformations or more general business problems to solutions that benefit all parties involved, including end users and managers alike.
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant || Information Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Ziggo uses Cramer/Amdocs to link Ziggo services and customers with the physical Ziggo network. To achieve said link it needs daily interfaces with different software systems in a correct fashion. Due to the merger with UPC and other events leading to increased database usage, records and requirements, the runtimes of the aforementioned interfaces needed to be brought back to acceptable levels. 

The CGI project team was asked to develop and guide implementation of several adjustments to interfaces. My role was to develop a strategy, approach and plan for testing the interfaces and the adjustments. I also initialized system testing of the interfaces and assisted the project team in delivering a thorough product. Due to my solution-driven mindset, quick wit and precision, I contributed to the project team and successful delivery of the interfaces and their adjustments. 

Stakeholders referred to the project team's interface adjustments as much needed as well as progressive and the products were all taken into production.
profile_positions.title: Test Manager

profile_positions.description:
Ziggo uses Cramer/Amdocs to link Ziggo services and customers with the physical Ziggo network. To achieve said link it needs daily interfaces with different software systems in a correct fashion. Due to the merger with UPC and other events leading to increased database usage, records and requirements, the runtimes of the aforementioned interfaces needed to be brought back to acceptable levels. 

The CGI project team was asked to develop requirements and a plan, with impact, to implement a high-level solution. My role was to gather and engineer all relevant requirements and to assist the project team in delivering a thorough project proposal. Through my out-of-the-box mentality, problem-solving attitude, clear communication and precision in thought, I contributed to the project team and the proposed solution. 

The proposed solution was positively received and stakeholders were happy issues were addressed accordingly. This resulted in a signed contract to start developing the proposed software solutions.
profile_positions.title: Information Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Functionally CGI manages the Oracle E-Business Suite R12 environment of MOL Logistics. Through calls issues with the Oracle application are investigated and solutions provided for MOL. 
I assist the local team by identifying the solution to issues and communicating this solution to the team and the business as a customer. 

So far, all issues have been solved and documented.

Tools: Oracle E-Business Suite R12 GL/SLA/AP/AR
profile_positions.title: Functional Application Manager

profile_positions.description:
Because of the volume of bank statements through APRO, Oracle Cash Management and Receivables pressuring the team’s workload, optimization of automatic bank statement processing was needed. To this end a business case was written, to better connect bank transaction codes of APRO with bank transaction codes within Oracle Cash Management as well as add search rules to automatically match uniquely identified lines within bank statements. 

The team lead of the receivables team of the Shared Service Center for the Dienst Justitiële Inrichtingen employed me to carry out this business case in conjunction with local functional application management. I quickly understood important issues within individual bank statement processing which lead to the optimization project being successfully completed within time and budget constraints. The team lead indicated to be content with the end result.

Tools: Oracle E-Business Suite R12 (CM/AR), APRO Banking Gateway, MS-Excel
profile_positions.title: Oracle Business Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Due to an upgrade of the PeopleSoft environment more than hundred letters used by the shared service center of the Human Resource division of KPN needed to be migrated to the new environment with adaptations to provide for more autonomous work. The project leader hired me to build the letters according to the redesigned format with use of BI Publisher templates in MS-Word connected with query’s on the PeopleSoft environment. 

At the end of this short project I was able to design complex templates and managed to create my own connected query’s derived from the data, mainly due my adaptability. The project leader and project members from the shared service center acknowledged my contribution to the fact that the project was on time, within budget and up to quality standards.

Tools: PeopleSoft HRMS 8.8, PeopleTools 8.51.21, BI Publisher, MS-Word, VMware
profile_positions.title: Oracle Business Consultant

profile_positions.description:
At the end of 2012 a conversion to Oracle E-Business Suite R12 took place. The head of real estate administration asked me to provide after-care on a data and process level and to construct management information reports regarding real-estate data and master data. 

I added value by ensuring standards for quality and thoroughness for the corrections of migration output. In my role as business intelligence information analyst I conceptualized, worked out and created over 30 reports. By doing consistency checks, upgrading data standards and enhancing data requirements, I improved the quality of the administration of the 7 million square meters of gross floor area real estate portfolio. To this date the reports and dashboards are still made use of.

Tools: Oracle EBS (PM/SiteHub/CustomerHub), MS-Excel, MS-Access, OBIEE, Business Objects
profile_positions.title: Master Data and Business Intelligence Information Analyst

profile_positions.description: I solved financial problems for liaisons and companies seeking financial service on an interim basis.
profile_positions.title: Financial Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Changes within health care regulations and their administrative needs have led to increased work pressure approaching the year-end. I was detached to assist the debit administration. Due to my way of working additional time was found to correct DBC administrations and enable the billing of partner hospitals. The debit project was delivered within time and scope and no backlog for the specific DBC corrections remained.

Tools: SAP Fi/Co, MS-Excel
profile_positions.title: DBC Administrator / Assistant Debitcontroller
